nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS2
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS2 (2.2 m x 2.5 m) has been reduced to around 30 cm in height (43.919΄ / 06.246΄ / 4970 m).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS3
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS3 (2.5 m x 2.5 m) is situated 11 m southwest and 3 m lower than FS2. It has been reduced o its fragmentary base.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS4
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS4 (2.2 m x 2.3 m) is situated 4 m west of FS3 at the same elevation. This somewhat better preserved specimen appears to have been aligned in the cardinal directions.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS5
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS5 (1.9 m x 2 m) is highly fragmentary (43.958΄ / 06 235΄ / 5000 m). The extant base of the structure has a maximum height of 50 cm, and appears to have been aligned in the cardinal directions. There is another possible cubic tomb in the vicinity but too little remains to be certain of its identity (43.966΄ / 06.270΄ / 4990 m).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS6
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS6 has degraded so that only fragments of its base and upper section remain (44.112΄ / 06.128΄ / 5090 m).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS7
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS7 (2.2 m x 2 m) is a highly degraded specimen with little height (44.187΄ / 06.052΄ / 5140 m).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS8
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS8 (2.2 m x 2 m) has been reduced to a dissolute base (44.218΄ / 06.027΄ / 5170 m).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS9
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS9 (2 m x 2.2 m) is situated 10 m northwest of FS8. This specimen is 40 cm to 60 cm in height, and is aligned in the cardinal directions. The central chamber (45 cm x 60 cm) has survived to a depth of 30 cm. The central chamber is lined with smaller stones than those used for the construction of the outer walls.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS10
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS10 is a heavily degraded specimen, about 40 cm in height (44.266΄ / 06.013΄ / 5190 m). It appears to have been aligned in the cardinal directions.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS11
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS11 (2.2 m x 2 m) is the highest cubic tomb at Rusbel MukpoRus sbal smug po (44.308΄ / 06.002΄ / 5200 m). It has been reduced to a height of 50 cm or less. FS11 does not appear to have been aligned in the cardinal directions. The central chamber has been gutted but it is still clearly discernable. It has a maximum depth of 40 cm.
